WorkItem.ClosedComment: Change it to set headers and save to php://output as shown in 01simple-download-xls.php and 01simple-download-xlsx.php

WorkItem.Summary: In Example file [05featuredemo.php] how to change the Excel (.xlsx)  save in browser?

Comments.Message:
Dear MarkBaker,

I changed Excel created but not opened i have the error when opening the Excel..

regards,
@gsivaprabu

Then remove every single echo statement in the file, because any output by the script is being injected into the file and that's corrupting the file content. 


You'll notice that none of the "download" examples have any output other than that generated by the call to save(). You'll also find that it's the answer to half of the questions here on the discussion board.

It's not an "issue" with PHPExcel, it's standard PHP behaviour that if you echo something then it goes to php://output, and if you're also streaming the data from save() to php://output then the two will be combined
